justification: Table 1 lists the parameter z and labels it “Pre-decision bias or starting point bias,” showing that this construct is captured by the z parameter of the diffusion decision model.

In Table 1 the entry for v (Drift rate) states, “This parameter shows the rate of information processing and task difficulty,” indicating that the drift-rate parameter measures information-processing speed.
Table 1 describes the boundary separation parameter a as “the index of the speed-accuracy tradeoff,” linking this psychological construct to the a parameter of the model.
The text under Table 1 notes that the Non-decision time parameter “shows motor time and encoding time,” specifying that t0 measures these processing stages.
